Sentece: On the basis of this influence we have been able to differentiate between three groups of patients: (a) in six patients (five of them with frequent off episodes) LD values were significantly lower (p less than 0.05) when both drugs were given together (area under the curve [AUC] +/- SE 2.10 +/- 0.42 micrograms/ml/h vs. 4.96 +/- 1.10 micrograms/ml/h); (b) in eight patients (one with frequent akinesia) LD levels were significantly higher (p less than 0.003) when both drugs were given together (AUC +/- SE 4.05 +/- 0.51 micrograms/ml/h vs. 1.94 +/- 0.19 micrograms/ml/h); (c) in six patients (without motor fluctuations) no difference in LD levels was noted (AUC +/- SE 3.91 + 0.62 micrograms/ml/h vs. 3.81 +/- 0.70 micrograms/ml/h).
